content: Well, I'd hate to see that for those who have no other option. I have a certain amount of Medical Insurance from my civilian retirement, so I'm going to do the best I can not to burden the Federal System. That way, maybe the money can go for somebody not so fortunate. All my uncles used the VA pretty extensively in their later years. They were all WW II Vets. But Dad never did. He stayed with Blue Cross/Blue Shield, which he earned retiring as a Welder from United States Steel. He didn't want to be on the Federal nickle unless he had no other option, yet he had been on Saipan and Iwo Jima. So he'd certainly earned VA help. He just wanted to be independent from all that, and that's the way I hope to do - but I'd hate to see anyone lose what they've earned by getting shot at while in the GI Uniform - - Wandering and Wondering
reply: Well, I'd hate to see that for those who have no other option. I have a certain amount of Medical Insurance from my civilian retirement, so I'm going to do the best I can not to burden the Federal System. That way, maybe the money can go for somebody not so fortunate. All my uncles used the VA pretty extensively in their later years. They were all WW II Vets. But Dad never did. He stayed with Blue Cross/Blue Shield, which he earned retiring as a Welder from United States Steel. He didn't want to be on the Federal nickle unless he had no other option, yet he had been on Saipan and Iwo Jima. So he'd certainly earned VA help. He just wanted to be independent from all that, and that's the way I hope to do - but I'd hate to see anyone lose what they've earned by getting shot at while in the GI Uniform - - Wandering and Wondering

content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: OK its been on the news for weeks now and other posts talk about it. Obama tried to make service connected Veterans pay for they health care instead of the VA paying for it. How low can you go? This week he dropped the subject as it might lower his popularity poll numbers. I use the VA regularly. I can't stand the insurance health programs I've been with. Seems they are always nickel and dimeing you all the way. The VA's health care is as good or better than some of the high cost programs I've been with. I've had the various Govt. Employee Fed, State and local govt. health insurance plans and I still prefer the VA's system. They are slow but then I think the money they should be spending on more help gets blown on some freekin statue or office furniture. The way to keep them on their toes is to let them know that you expect them to help you as soon as they can and show some respect. I always start every conversation with a VA employee with, "Hows your day going"? If it's not flowing for them I just try to make a positive comment, sometimes that's difficult especially when I'm in pain but hey. Unfortunately every visit to the VA Hospital usually ends with a visit to the pharmacy and that can get me steamed sometimes. I don't think they coordinate with the doctors very well. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

content: change is scary, especially when change afects us. but why fear change? like death, it is unavoidable. why is there a hesitance here to accept change and ADAPT to it? humanity has dealt with change since we have been on this earth adam and eve dealt wi the first ever eviction but they adapted. Joseph, Moses, Colombus, hitler, clinton, Bush... everyone dealt with change, for good of for bad.. and it only makes us stronger. stop fearing change, and embrace it. make it part of your lives...

content: Technically, I'm not a college graduate, but I only have seven credits left until graduation, so hopefully you'll let me slide in on this one. -President Obama considered making wounded veterans use personal health insurance to help pay for the cost of VA care. For the wounded veterans who are no longer productive members of society, according to Speaker of the House Pelosi, this is a good plan; we don't need people leeching off of the government. -President Obama wants to release the innocent people who were unfairly detained at Gitmo, and has considered letting them go to the U.S. As a baby-killing Iraq veteran, should I fear reprisals for the war crimes that I have commited? -President Obama wants to lessen troop commitment in Iraq, yet he won't pull them out either. I know that President Obama has always been against the war in Iraq (since he was in his mother's womb, in fact), so I can only assume that, as President, he has come upon classified information which has made him alter his course. Normally, I would chalk this up to politicians acting politiciany, but President Obama came into Washington in order to change things, I hope. -President Obama makes me feel that the time that I had spent in Iraq (fortunately, I wasn't wounded, or else I'd be a drain on government funds) was worthwhile. -Vice-President Biden hit the nail on the head when he targeted the U.S. soldiers, who do not pay taxes while deployed, as being the unpatriotic leeches that they are.
reply: Technically, I'm not a college graduate, but I only have seven credits left until graduation, so hopefully you'll let me slide in on this one. -President Obama considered making wounded veterans use personal health insurance to help pay for the cost of VA care. For the wounded veterans who are no longer productive members of society, according to Speaker of the House Pelosi, this is a good plan; we don't need people leeching off of the government. -President Obama wants to release the innocent people who were unfairly detained at Gitmo, and has considered letting them go to the U.S. As a baby-killing Iraq veteran, should I fear reprisals for the war crimes that I have commited? -President Obama wants to lessen troop commitment in Iraq, yet he won't pull them out either. I know that President Obama has always been against the war in Iraq (since he was in his mother's womb, in fact), so I can only assume that, as President, he has come upon classified information which has made him alter his course. Normally, I would chalk this up to politicians acting politiciany, but President Obama came into Washington in order to change things, I hope. -President Obama makes me feel that the time that I had spent in Iraq (fortunately, I wasn't wounded, or else I'd be a drain on government funds) was worthwhile. -Vice-President Biden hit the nail on the head when he targeted the U.S. soldiers, who do not pay taxes while deployed, as being the unpatriotic leeches that they are.

content: Well, I'd hate to see that for those who have no other option. I have a certain amount of Medical Insurance from my civilian retirement, so I'm going to do the best I can not to burden the Federal System. That way, maybe the money can go for somebody not so fortunate. All my uncles used the VA pretty extensively in their later years. They were all WW II Vets. But Dad never did. He stayed with Blue Cross/Blue Shield, which he earned retiring as a Welder from United States Steel. He didn't want to be on the Federal nickle unless he had no other option, yet he had been on Saipan and Iwo Jima. So he'd certainly earned VA help. He just wanted to be independent from all that, and that's the way I hope to do - but I'd hate to see anyone lose what they've earned by getting shot at while in the GI Uniform - - Wandering and Wondering
reply: Well, I'd hate to see that for those who have no other option. content: change is scary, especially when change afects us. but why fear change? like death, it is unavoidable. why is there a hesitance here to accept change and ADAPT to it? humanity has dealt with change since we have been on this earth adam and eve dealt wi the first ever eviction but they adapted. Joseph, Moses, Colombus, hitler, clinton, Bush... everyone dealt with change, for good of for bad.. and it only makes us stronger. stop fearing change, and embrace it. make it part of your lives...

content: Technically, I'm not a college graduate, but I only have seven credits left until graduation, so hopefully you'll let me slide in on this one. -President Obama considered making wounded veterans use personal health insurance to help pay for the cost of VA care. For the wounded veterans who are no longer productive members of society, according to Speaker of the House Pelosi, this is a good plan; we don't need people leeching off of the government. -President Obama wants to release the innocent people who were unfairly detained at Gitmo, and has considered letting them go to the U.S. As a baby-killing Iraq veteran, should I fear reprisals for the war crimes that I have commited? -President Obama wants to lessen troop commitment in Iraq, yet he won't pull them out either. I know that President Obama has always been against the war in Iraq (since he was in his mother's womb, in fact), so I can only assume that, as President, he has come upon classified information which has made him alter his course. Normally, I would chalk this up to politicians acting politiciany, but President Obama came into Washington in order to change things, I hope. -President Obama makes me feel that the time that I had spent in Iraq (fortunately, I wasn't wounded, or else I'd be a drain on government funds) was worthwhile. -Vice-President Biden hit the nail on the head when he targeted the U.S. soldiers, who do not pay taxes while deployed, as being the unpatriotic leeches that they are.
